titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Edward E. Smuts Papers, 1945-1981 AIS.2012.07
titlestmt.author: Sarita Wescott.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-06-11 09:58:26 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: The Edward E. Smuts Papers document the professional career and involvement of Ed Smuts with urban planning in Pittsburgh and the surrounding area. Smuts served as the president of the Regional Industrial Development Consultants (RIDC) from 1957-1959 and deputy director for the City Planning and Development of Pittsburgh from 1965-1970; he owned his own urban consulting firm, Urban Development Consultants Incorporated, from 1960-1984.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Edward E. Smuts was born October 25, 1924. He married Marjorie Palmer and had six children (Peter, Thomas, Shannon, Christian, Matthew and Daniel). Throughout his life, Smuts was active in many associations, including the American Institute of Planners, Pittsburgh Chapter of American Society for Public Administration, American Society of Planning Officials, and Pittsburgh History & Landmarks Foundation.

Smuts earned his B.A. from Carnegie Institute of Technology in 1946. After earning his master's degree in Business Administration from Harvard Univeristy, Smuts returned to Pittsburgh to start his career in the urban planning. His first job was with the Pennsylvania Economy League of Pittsburgh. In 1957 Smuts took the position as president of Regional Industrial Development Cooperation (RIDC). He left RIDC in 1959 to become an independent planning consultant.

Smuts established Urban Development Consultants Incorporated and served as president from 1960-1965. His company performed consulting and market research studies of the Pittsburgh area. Some of these research studies included, mass transportation, air pollution, and business development sites. From 1965-1970 he served as deputy director of City Planning and Development in Pittsburgh. As deputy director Smuts took action in projects to improve transportation, parking, business development, and university expansion. Some of these projects were Craig Street project, Carnegie Mellon University, and Greenway projects around Pittsburgh.

In 1970 Smuts returned to Urban Development Consultants, Inc. During his career as president of his consulting form, Smuts contributed to diverse development projects around the Pittsburgh and Allegheny County area.
Edward Smuts died on February 2, 1984 in Pittsburgh.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of Marjorie Palmer Smuts on November 5, 2012.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Edward E. Smuts Papers document the various professional positions he held in the capacity of an urban planner in the Pittsburgh area. The papers include business material, correspondence, meeting notes, project agendas, agreements between organizations, lease agreements, financial reports, data surveys, statistics, press releases, published reports, studies, and proposals. The topics covered by the papers include urban planning, urban redevelopment, greenway projects, traffic planning, university development, hospital ventures, and county planning in Southwestern Pennsylvania.

processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Sarita Wescott in 2013-2014.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The University of Pittsburgh holds the property rights to the material in this collection, but the copyright may still be held by the original creator/author. Researchers are therefore advised to follow the regulations set forth in the U.S. Copyright Code when publishing, quoting, or reproducing material from this collection without the consent of the creator/author or that go beyond what is allowed by fair use.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged into the following series:
Series I. Department of City Planning and Development
Series V. Regional Industrial Development Corporation
Series VII. Urban Development Consultations, Inc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series covers the period that Smuts was the of Deputy Director of City Planning of Pittsburgh (1965-1970) and beyond. Materials document City Planning projects and program and include agreements, reports, and correspodence.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries represents various projects and programs of the Department of City Planning. Materials contained in these folders include memorandum of projects, agendas, press release, agreements, reference materials, project proposals, financial/expenditures reports, photographs, presentation reports, area surveys, and multiple forms of communications.

scopecontent.p: This subseries contains reports, studies, and proposals on City Planning project such as, North side redevelopment, highways and transportation, stadiums, Golden Triangle redevelopment, housing, Homewood-Brushton improvements and more.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series highlights Smuts' work with the Pennsylvania Economy League. Some of the folders contain in-depth reports and information about counties in southwestern Pennsylvania, including field reports, contacts, industrial surveys, pamphlets, demographics, and planning programs.

did.unittitle: "A More Effective Industrial Development Program for the Pittsburgh Region"
"A More Effective Industrial Development Program for the Pittsburgh Region – Appendices"
"Recommended Program and Staffing of the Pennsylvania Department of Commerce"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Personal series contains Smuts' correspondence with local businesses, professional associations, and personal acquaintances. It also includes materials related to voter registration drives in Allegheny County. Other folders include materials concerning his marriage to Marjorie Palmer and her business, Marj Palmer Associates.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series covers the multitude of professional and personal associations that Smuts was involved with throughout his life. It contains newsletters, by-laws, correspondence, and speeches. Of special note are the files on the Pittsburgh History & Landmarks Foundation, which includes flyers, memorandums, correspondence, handwritten notes, and newsletters. Smuts also taught Urban Studies classes at both Carnegie Mellon University (CMU) and the University of Pittsburgh; this folder contains the syllabus, correspondence, list of textbooks, presentation slides and notes. Smuts was also actively involved with the CMU Alumni Association, which is documented in a single folder of photographs, committee reports, executive board meeting notes, pamphlets, and newspaper clippings.

did.unittitle: Courses - University of Pittsburgh and CMU
National Association of Housing & Redevelopment Officials

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series includes documentation on projects of the Regional Industrial Development Corporation (RIDC) during the Smuts' tenure as its president (1957-1959) and beyond. This series also includes a significant amount of promotional material compiled on Pittsburgh area companies and includes industrial statistics for the area.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries consists of subject folders related to various projects and reference material of the RIDC. Folders reflect daily operations and business relationships, board meeting minutes, agenda, notices, correspondence, press releases, copies of newspaper articles, and indexes.

did.unittitle: Industrial Area Renewal Program, Industrial Standards (Idea Book)
Minutes, Agenda, and Notices, RIDC Board Meetings
Pennsylvania Department of Labor and Industry

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The RIDC reports and studies found in this subseries appear to be used throughout Smuts' career and many date beyond his tenure with the agency. Many of these reports were used as informational tools to encourage companies to relocate to southwestern Pennsylvania. Included here are RIDC annual reports, studies on the expansion of the highway system around Pittsburgh, steep slope studies, and preliminary analysis of potential companies trageted for relocation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains a variety of subject and project files that do not clearly related to the various professional positions held by Smuts. Clearly Smuts had some involvement in these projects but the relationship is not clearly evident in all cases.

did.unittitle: American Society for Public Administration - Meeting and Reports
Noise Pollution: The Rising Racket, (Audio tape)
Housing Authority of the City of Pittsburgh
Pittsburgh Comprehensive Plan and Development Program
Urban Design Consultants, Inc. - Clifton Park

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Urban Development Consultants series documents the primary consulting firm founded and operated by Smuts. The firm's primary clients include public, civic and private development organizations within the Greater Pittsburgh region.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Smuts actively participated in the development of Greenway projects by evaluating Environmentally Sensitive/Predominately Vacant areas of Pittsburgh. The subseries focus on various projects, land leases, studies that relate to the vacant land areas. Included in the folders are agenda of meetings, program and project proposals, annual reports, notes, analysis, blueprints, budget and service expenses.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries includes invoice reports, financial ledgers, consulting time sheets, and employee payroll and expense reports.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains documentation on multiple greenway projects that the UDC consulted on. The contents include area maps, blueprints, appraisal reports of property, lot and block order lists, project proposals, correspondence, gift of property procedure with documentation, pubic property transfer outline, reports, notes, newspaper clippings, budget reports, and project proposals. Some photographic materials are also included in project files. The images depict residential lots, aerial views, and neighborhood views.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The UDC created a subsidiary component entitled the Health Systems Consultant to work with the Health Systems Agency of Southwestern Pennsylvania, which studied the health care needs and services of the region. The contents include facility studies, program and project agendas, budget reports, meeting notes, program improvement plans and reports, hospital occupation statistics, hospital trustee's seminar, and agreements.

scopecontent.p: UDA worked in association with the JDJ Associates on a redevelopment project focused on Craig Street in the Oakland neighborhood of Pittsburgh. The project inlcudes documentation on commercial development of the street.

scopecontent.p: This subseries includes documentation on the planning process to produce a redevelopment plan for the Oakland neighborhood of Pittsburgh during the 1970's. Included are committee meeting agendas, meeting notes, memorandums, general reference materials, and proposals.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The subseries consists of project and subject files, generally these were not part of larger projects undertaken by the firm, but reflect a wide range of business activity and professional projects. Included are significant documentation on projects for Carnegie Mellon University, Craig Square Shops, Health Systems Consultants, Mine Safety Appliances, Point Park College, and Westinghouse. Content of the folders include: business correspondence, memorandums, handwritten notes, proposals, reference materials, statistics of the project area, financial reports, pamphlets, blueprints, press releases, maps, photographs, area data, and related published materials.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series focuses on vacant and sensitive properties in relationship to potential greenway projects. The properties are predominately located in the city of Pittsburgh. Included in the files are data on potential development sites, budget reports, correspondence, land management studies, greenway proposals, block address reports, hand written notes, photographs, land maps and graphs, meeting agendas and reports.

did.unittitle: Area Information N-4 Spring Hill/Spring Garden
Area Information S-3 West Point Office Park

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series documents Smuts professional activity for the Urban Redevelopment Authority of Pittsburgh. Smuts involvement includes projects that focus on transportation, land usage and development. Papers include notes, internal and external correspondence, fact sheets, meeting notes, agendas, blueprints, memos, reports and studies, project reviews, and cost analysis reports.

did.unittitle: Proposals and Reports on Silver Lake, Chartiers Valley, and Wilkinsburg projects
Transit, Mass & Rapid - PBQ&D - Progress Reports
Transit, Mass & Rapid - Technical Committee Minutes
